text: Schomburgk's Deer (recervus schomburgki) is a species of deer which became extinct in 1938. The deer was endemic to Thailand. Edward Blyth described it in 1863, and named it after Sir Robert Hermann Schomburgk, who was consul in Bangkok from 1857-1864. Category:Deer Category:Mammals of Asia Category:Extinct mammals
title: Schomburgk's deer
